meanings.definition: A drug used to treat motion sickness and nausea.
meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed scopolamine to help with my seasickness.
meanings.sent2: She always carries scopolamine with her when traveling to prevent feeling sick.
meanings.sent3: After taking scopolamine, I felt like I was floating on a cloud!
meanings.sent4: The effects of scopolamine made the world seem like a gentle, rocking boat.
meanings.sent5: The scopolamine pill was like a magic potion, banishing nausea instantly.

meanings.definition: A substance derived from plants in the nightshade family.
meanings.sent1: The herbalist explained the benefits of scopolamine from nightshade plants.
meanings.sent2: Nightshade vegetables contain scopolamine, which can have medicinal properties.
meanings.sent3: I never knew that scopolamine came from such mysterious plants!
meanings.sent4: The essence of scopolamine whispered secrets of the nightshade family.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of scopolamine hinted at its origins in the nightshade plants.

meanings.definition: A medication that can cause drowsiness and confusion.
meanings.sent1: Be careful when taking scopolamine as it may make you feel sleepy.
meanings.sent2: The side effects of scopolamine include drowsiness and mental fog.
meanings.sent3: Oops, I took scopolamine before the party and ended up napping on the couch!
meanings.sent4: The scopolamine haze enveloped my mind in a dreamy cloud.
meanings.sent5: The drowsiness induced by scopolamine was like a gentle lullaby, coaxing me to sleep.
